books.author: by Mark R. Levin
books.description: The Fox News host gives his take on the Green New Deal, critical race theory and social activism.
books.name: AMERICAN MARXISM

books.author: by Carol Leonnig and Philip Rucker
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning reporters examine Trump’s final year in office, with a focus on the key players around him.
books.name: I ALONE CAN FIX IT

books.author: by Ben Shapiro
books.description: The conservative commentator describes what he perceives as threats to American business, education and politics.
books.name: THE AUTHORITARIAN MOMENT

books.author: by Jesse Watters
books.description: The Fox News host recounts his career and prescribes ways to defend against what he considers left-wing radicalism.
books.name: HOW I SAVED THE WORLD

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: An account of the Great Migration of 1915-70, in which nearly six million African-Americans abandoned the South.
books.name: THE WARMTH OF OTHER SUNS

books.author: by Michael Wolff
books.description: The author of “Fire and Fury” and “Siege” portrays events during the final days of Trump’s presidency.
books.name: LANDSLIDE

books.author: by Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.
books.name: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by Michael C. Bender
books.description: A senior White House reporter for The Wall Street Journal looks at Trump’s 2020 campaign and final year in office.
books.name: FRANKLY, WE DID WIN THIS ELECTION

books.author: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it.
books.name: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: by Michael Pollan
books.description: A look at arbitrary beliefs surrounding opium, caffeine and mescaline, which are derived from plants.
books.name: THIS IS YOUR MIND ON PLANTS

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The 10th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series looks at organized crime in the United States during the 20th century.
books.name: KILLING THE MOB

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
books.name: CASTE

books.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
books.name: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS
